phrases: I will leave the solids to you.
All right!
Azuki's moving tomorrow, is not she?
We have three days to bring in the finished manuscript.
We must use all the time we have to make it even a little better.
All right, I will do my best on it.
I will wait.
I will wait forever.
Are you going to get that?
Ignore it.
It is probably someone selling newspapers or something.
Mashiro!
Takagi!
You are there, are not you?!
It is Miyoshi.
Ignore it.
There is no way I can do that.
When she finds out later that I was here, she will beat the crap out of me.
Where is Mashiro?
He is drawing.
We have got our deadline in three days, so do not bother him.
Hey!
Sorry for the intrusion.
Miyoshi!
Mashiro... kun.
Mashiro... kun.
What?
Why did not you tell Miho your email address?
Eh?
Ah, you are right.
I know hers, but she still does not know mine.
Unless you email her at least once, she will not know, will she?
So even though you met with her after graduation, you did not tell her?
I was not thinking about stuff like email addresses then.
We both only said one sentence to each other.
One sentence?
What?
I am not telling you.
Well fine, but you need to tell her your email.
She cannot even email you to say she is moving.
I know that because you told me, Miyoshi.
I did not tell her I told you.
Anyway, send an email her at least once.
It does not matter what it is about.
I do not want the first email I send her to be random like that.
I do think it would be better to do it sooner, but I need to finish the manuscript.
So I cannot email her now.
Okay.
Then go ahead and say that I told you she is moving.
Then I am sure she will send you a very nice email in reply.
All right, work hard, you two!
Miyoshi sure is a good person deep down.
I know, right?
Okay, we must get this done by the deadline!
I guess the younger they are, the faster they progress.
No, that is not the only reason for this.
It is like they put their souls into this.
What do you think?
I can really feel your desire to win against Niizuma-kun in it.
This is an amazing manuscript.
You did really well.
Yes, thank you very much!
We are finally done...
Now I can email Azuki.
Want to go get something good to eat?
Ah, no.
I will be okay for today.
I pulled two all-nighters, you see.
Sorry.
Sorry.
I see.
You two do look tired.
Okay, then all there is left is to think of the comment to put in on the last page.
We worked really hard to draw this, and we would be delighted to hear your impressions is fine, right?
Okay, let us go with that.
All right, then.
Ah, do you two have bank accounts?
No, I do not.
Me neither.
Your payment for the manuscript is given via a bank deposit, so make one by June.
Um... I hate to ask, but how much is our manuscript payment?
I knew he would ask.
Newcomers all get 9000 yen a page.
He is definitely calculating that right now.
Now all that is left is the questionnaire results.
Hattori-san assessment was good, too.
Seems like we can win.
Are you okay?
Oh, see you later.
See you later ?
This is Mashiro.
Good evening.
Maybe Good evening, this is Mashiro would be better.
The greeting should be first.
No, I do not need this sort of thing.
I should apologize for writing those weird things to her in class that made her cry.
Oh, and also for not sending her chocolate on White Day.
TL note: White Day takes place on March 14th when boys send chocolate to girls.
Also, sorry for not saying much on our graduation day.
It is kind of all just apologies...
OOkay...
Now to tell her about us running in NEXT!
and the day it goes on sale...
Huh?
I cannot type anymore?
Why?
Character limit?!
True, 5000 characters...
No way, I have already typed that much?!
AAnyway, I have to read over what I have written so far.
I have looked over it again and again...
It is already 9AM...
Well, whatever.
GO!
Okay, guess I will go to sleep.
An email?
Azuki?!
So fast!
So short!
I am really happy she replied, but...
compared to my 5000-character long one...
Okay, I will just send one in a sort of joking way...
Azuki-san, is not your email a little short?
We can finally email each other, so should not we talk to each other more?
Okay.
Send.
Time for bed.
Another fast one?!
Meh?
That is so cute...
She had this kind of side?
And it is still so short.
But Azuki's right.
Hello?
Hey, Shuujin...
in case we get first place in the questionnaires,
start thinking about making a serialization name for Kane to Chie.
We do not have time to play around.
Do it!
Understand?!
What is with that authoritative tone?
Hey, Hattori!
Yes?
This Takagi-Mashiro team has gotten way better from the name stage.
Yeah, I really thought so.
This thing's really interesting.
Oh, thank you.
Even the ever-scathing Aida-san...
Vice Editor-in-Chiefs Yahagi-san and Heishi-san both gave good assessments.
This really could beat Niizuma-kun.
That will never become wide-reaching popular.
There is no way Niizuma Eiji will lose.
Takagi, Mashiro!
You two are in the same class!
Miyoshi, you showed up?
Of course I did!
You are in class 1 with Suzuki and Saitou from Ake-middle.
Why am I the only one in class 3?
It is true.
Saikou, do you think we should have a penname?
It would be a pain if this gets out in school.
Like what happened with Ishizawa.
I guess so.
I am fine with it if you are, but will we make it in time for NEXT!?
I will email Hattori-san and ask.
He said if we do it today, we can make it in time.
Then could you think of one during the entrance ceremony?
Me too, me too!
That is okay.
We do not need you to think about it, too.
Do not hit me, okay?
I was not going to!
I think it would be best to make it a blend of our names.
Maki Morito or something...
Well, I guess then no one would figure it out.
How is this?
Ashiro Muto.
So Miho and Mashiro's dream comes true.
TL note: The name is made up of the kanjis of: A from Azuki, shiro from Mashiro, mu meaning dream and to meaning come true.
Miho would love this, do not you think?
Why am I not in it?!
I am not in it either.
You do not have anything to do with it, I am an author!
Okay, then...
TL note: Now, added, is the kanji for gi from Takagi.
Ashirogi Muto.
What do you think, Mashrio?
Well, it is kind of cliche, and sort of embarrassing.
Huh?
How?
Well, uhh, I do not really care, so...
Then it is decided.
Sounds good.
I will contact Hattori-san.
Sure.
This is good.
This really might make Azuki happy.
Okay, send!
That was fast!
Let us make our dream come true, just like your pen name says.
I am so glad.
Just like I thought, Azuki also...
But...
It is really short again!
This is a sample issue I just got.
Thank you so much!
Ours is...
There!
Awesome!
It is a real manga now!
It is totally moving!
Yeah!
Niizuma Eiji's CROW.
It really is good.
Its sense of speed and intensity makes you want to read it all at once.
I read ours countless times since it had become a name...
so I do not know if it is interesting or not anymore.
No, ours is more interesting.
You are really confident, are not you?
Ah, sorry.
It is just my personal opinion,
but I felt like ours was a more interesting read.
Yeah.
I think you will win, too.
The story Takagi-kun wrote matches perfectly with the drawings Mashiro-kun drew.
They draw out each other's good points.
That is my number one reason for thinking you can do it.
Thank you very much.
But, Niizuma-san's story and drawing go well together too, do not they?
Certainly...
both Niizuma-kun's artwork and story are far from a newcomer's.
Especially the artwork.
But this cannot be helped.
He is already been drawing for ten years.
But Niizuma-kun will split votes with the other battle manga.
Ours does not have any works that overlap it.
So then...
You are saying that if we went one-on-one with him, we would lose?
A magazine will always have lots of works running in it,
so I do not think this is a bad way to operate.
More than anything...
the most important factor for success in Jack is the questionnaire results.
Questionnaires...
Jack's manga are ranked every week according to these questionnaire postcards.
It is a serious battle.
Just like boxers standing in the ring every week.
These questionnaires have me swinging back and forth between happiness and worry.
I have taken every place from second to twentieth, but...
I have never once been first.
I would really like to get first, even if it is just once.
That is a dream I have had ever since I got serialized.
When do the questionnaire results come out?
There are two; the early report and the real deal.
The early report is a hand-counted total of a hundred cards that came early.
For the main magazine, they comes out on Tuesdays, the day after it goes on sale.
The real deal comes out of a lot more that arrive...
by putting a thousand randomly selected cards in a computer.
It gives us in detail which got the number one most interesting votes,
which got second most and third most votes,
what averages ages for whom sent them in,
and the ranking and gender ratio for each age.
That comes out on Friday for the main magazine,
but for NEXT!
it is around two weeks after it goes on sale.
The early report and the real deal...
So it happens twice.
To be precise, we take them one more time,
but we only tell the authors up to the real deal.
So... would you like me to tell you the early report, too?
The real deal counts for everything, though.
If the real deal is everything,
then hearing the early report does not have much of a meaning, does it?
We have the early report so authors can get their readers impressions in a chart...
and find out what they want for what comes next in their story.
There are some that do not want to hear the real deal or the early report.
They say, Only tell me when I am in first.
So even if we do not hear the early report...
No, I am a little curious about both of them.
Please tell us.
Got it.
I am pretty sure we can do it, but...
Just as I said before,
we do not know for certain what will be popular, beforehand.
So you should be prepared for any kind of results.
Right.
Well, there is still quite a while before the results come out.
The best thing you can do is think about your next work.
Alright.
Well then, I will contact you when we get the early report.
Questionnaires, huh?
It is really put a damper on my excitement of running in NEXT!.
Well, I think we can win, so
Shuujin.
We can be serialized while we are going to high school.
I can finish the names, but what about you?
If it means getting serialized, I will do if even if it kills me.
Even if we get first, I do not think Hattori-san will try to serialize Kane to Chie.
Now that you mention it, he did say next work.
It is normal to get serialized after getting first in NEXT!.
Even more so if it is a first pushing down Eiji who is already basically been chosen for serialization.
But Hattori-san will not leave the idea of us only getting serialized once we are out of high school.
However, if we take first place...
and make a name for serialization that Hattori-san approves of...
Certainly.
In that case, he would consider it.
And if he is still reluctant, we can talk it out with people above him.
Saikou...
Our goal is to have an anime adaptation by eighteen.
We have to do that much.
It would be all right to have chapter one overlap with what runs in NEXT!, right?
Let us head back and get started on it right away.
Right!
In the end this world is money!
Smart people win using the power of money!
Man, that is so cruel to end it with that line!
This is good.
That finishes off chapter one's fifty-one pages.
Oh, it is an email from Azuki!
Do not look.
Azuki...
She really makes sure to send an email whenever something happens.
So today was the day NEXT!
goes on sale?
Oh, that is right!
We sure are incredible.
We got so wrapped up in our name that we forgot about the release date.
Azuki said it stood out in NEXT!.
That is our Azuki-san.
She has a good eye!
I am going to reply with Thank you.
Alright, let us get going on chapter two!
Whoa...
He is actually swimming in all the money.
Is not this going a little too far?
It is okay.
In chapter three all that money gets taken from him.
Hattori-san?
Is this the early report?!
Yes?
This is Takagi.
Yes.
For the early report, we are first!
YES!
But do not get relaxed.
You two have thirty-three votes.
Niizuma-kun has thirty-one votes.
A difference of two votes?
There is a possibility he will overtake you.
Below that is twenty-six... nineteen...
That Hattori guy...
If Eiji loses, it will put a damper on our serialization.
No, there is no way Niizuma Eiji will lose.
The real deal will definitely be in our favor!
Hey... if this keeps up and you get first, is Kono Yo wa Kane to Chie going to head for serialization?
Now that you mention it...
If we get first place in NEXT!...
Please think about us moving toward serialization.
No, they have still only entered high school.
But the authors probably really want to, do not they?
They sure do...
Then, we are done.
So should we call Hattori-san?
Tell him we finished a new name.
Do not tell him they are serialization names for Kane to Chie yet.
Got it.
You want to surprise Hattori-san, right?
Sorry for the wait.
Hello.
Thanks for coming.
First, I just got the results for the real deal.
Your rank for the real deal is...
Third place.
Third?
It is unfortunate you did not get first, but
third place for your first appearance in print is quite good.
First place is Niizuma Eiji-kun with 503 votes...
Below that was 312 votes.
You two had 308 votes.
In other words, you got proportionately the same as in the early report, but Niizuma-kun and the others increased.
We lost...
to Niizuma Eiji...
No... even more than Eiji...
Niizuma-kun, you got first place in the questionnaires.
Congratulations.
What are questionnaires?
When you ran your work for the Tezuka Award, I told you that you placed second, did not I?!
Ah, I probably just said Okay because I did not understand.
I think I can make the character designs for serialization even better.
I can probably go with this protagonist.
This is fine.
This boy does not need to know about the questionnaires and stuff.
You brought a name for a new work with you, did not you?
This is no good!
No good?
While you were talking to us, I came up with a lot of ideas.
I think we should redraw this now.
And to be honest...
from the shock of falling from first to third,
I am not really in the mood to talk about this...
But I told you over and over, third is incredible.
If you get disheartened at something simple like that
you will not be able to make it as a mangaka.
Having said that, the early report was good.
I understand how you feel.
How about we end it here for today?
Sorry...
Shuujin...
I want to try for something mainstream.
To be popular in Jack...
I think you have to be mainstream, after all.
But we were told there is no point in us trying something mainstream.
I think we should just do what we have been doing...
That was the plan to win against Eiji in NEXT!.
But we did not win.
Eiji got 503 votes out of 1000.
More than half the voters thought it was interesting.
A manga that two out of ten people will definitely think is interesting...
That is not good enough?
If we throw out half the votes from the outset, there is no way we can win!
I was thinking about it when I saw Eiji's work, but...
even for mainstream, it was not just the artwork that was good.
You could sort of see the author through the work.
It gave off a strong sense of uniqueness.
Yeah, I thought so, too.
A kind of How does he do this?
feeling.
Shuujin, you are great at making settings,
so if you make a simpler setting than what we have had so far
and use mainstream characters, I think we can do this.
In other words, it must be mainstream!
Saikou...
There are a bunch of people who do mainstream,
so being number one is hard.
In other words, doing cult is just running away!
What we are aiming for is number one in Japan!
Cult stories cannot be number one.
Let us start again from scratch!
Right!
What are you doing, throwing scraps of paper all over the place?!
Uh-oh!
Hey, hurry, we have to pick it up!
Y Yeah!
YYeah!
Oh, so this is where Jack is made?
That is Niizuma Eiji!
Could you be Ashirogi Muto?!
You know who we are?
Next time, Battle and Copying
When you embrace your dreams, rivals appear.
